message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we evaluate the impact of financial literacy on business performance in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes datasets from multiple sources, including the National Nutrition Survey and the National Indigenous Peoples Survey, to investigate the determinants of malnutrition among indigenous children in Mexico.", "dataset": ["National Nutrition Survey", "National Indigenous Peoples Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage two complementary datasets: data on precipitation and temperature from NASA's Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS) and conflict data from the Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED), to estimate the impact of climate variability on political instability in Africa.", "dataset": ["NASA's Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS)", "Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using household level data from the Bangladesh Integrated Household Survey, we analyze the impact of natural disasters on child nutritional outcomes.", "dataset": ["Bangladesh Integrated Household Survey"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "By combining data from the IMF's World Economic Outlook database and the World Tourism Organization's Tourism Statistics, we examine the relationship between exchange rate volatility and tourism flows across countries.", "dataset": ["IMF's World Economic Outlook database", "World Tourism Organization's Tourism Statistics"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes three datasets: the World Development Indicators, Doing Business, and Enterprise Surveys, to assess the competitiveness of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Latin America and the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Doing Business", "Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on a unique dataset of high-resolution satellite imagery and household survey data from Nigeria to evaluate the impact of electrification on household consumption.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite imagery", "household survey data from Nigeria"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from both the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys, we investigate the determinants of maternal health care utilization in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we combine data from various sources including the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Global Financial Inclusion database, to examine the linkages between financial inclusion, entrepreneurship, and shared prosperity in Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize datasets from multiple sources, including the International Energy Agency and the Global Wind Atlas, to examine the potential for wind energy development in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "Global Wind Atlas"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we evaluate the impact of financial literacy on business performance in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes datasets from multiple sources, including the National Nutrition Survey and the National Indigenous Peoples Survey, to investigate the determinants of malnutrition among indigenous children in Mexico.", "dataset": ["National Nutrition Survey", "National Indigenous Peoples Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage two complementary datasets: data on precipitation and temperature from NASA's Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS) and conflict data from the Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED), to estimate the impact of climate variability on political instability in Africa.", "dataset": ["NASA's Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS)", volatility and tourism flows across countries.", "dataset": ["IMF's World Economic Outlook database", "World Tourism Organization's Tourism Statistics"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "This study utilizes three datasets: the World Development Indicators, Doing Business, and Enterprise Surveys, to assess the competitiveness of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in Latin America and the Caribbean.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Doing Business", "Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on a unique dataset of high-resolution satellite imagery and household survey data from Nigeria to evaluate the impact of electrification on household consumption.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite imagery", "household survey data from Nigeria"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from both the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys, we investigate the determinants of maternal health care utilization in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we combine data from various sources including the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Global Financial Inclusion database, to examine the linkages between financial inclusion, entrepreneurship, and shared prosperity in Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize datasets from multiple sources, including the International Energy Agency and the Global Wind Atlas, to examine the potential for wind energy development in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "Global Wind Atlas"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]} ]
